outboundReferences.contextLine: - > ...treated as components in an additively decomposed utility function. In a finite horizon problem with $n$ decisions, the [[utility]] associated with a sequence of rewards $r_{1:n}$ is given by $\sum_{t=1}^{n} r_t$
- Also sometimes referred to as the [[return]]
A [[policy]] maps states to actions. In an MDP, we assume the next state depends only on the current, so we can write $\pi(s)$, also denoted as a *stationary policy*.

inboundReferences.contextLine: - Causal structures as directed acyclic graphs; see [[bayesian-network]]. The model implements a function $f_i$ for node/variable $X_i$, that maps parent nodes ($\mathrm{PA}_i$) of $X_i$ and stochastic variables $U_i$ into the state $X_i$. In other words, a function that takes into account past events to predict the current state: a [[markov-decision-process]].

fields.title: Causal Navigation by Continuous time Neural Networks

inboundReferences.contextLine: - Each node corresponds to a variable, with the directed edges their probabilities (transition probabilities like in [[markov-decision-process]]?)
Another word for the sum of rewards in [[markov-decision-process]], with the goal of maximizing this (typically).
